name: htmldoc
description:
Htmldoc(1)  converts  HTML and Markdown source files into indexed HTML, PostScript, or Portable Document Format (PDF) files that can be viewed online or printed.  With no options a HTML document is produced on stdout. 
The second form of htmldoc reads HTML source from stdin, which allows you to use htmldoc as a filter. 
The third form of htmldoc launches a graphical interface that allows you to change options and generate documents interactively.

options.--batch filename.book: Generates the specified book file without opening the GUI.
options.--bodycolor color: Specifies the background color for all pages.
options.--bodyfont {courier,helvetica,monospace,: Specifies the default text font used for text in the document body.
options.--textfont {courier,helvetica,monospace,: Sets the typeface that is used for text in the document
options.--bodyimage filename: Specifies the background image that is tiled on all pages.
options.--book: Specifies that the HTML sources are structured (headings, chapters, etc.)
options.--bottom margin: Specifies the bottom margin in points (no suffix or ##pt), inches (##in), centimeters (##cm), or millimeters (##mm).
options.--charset {cp-nnnn,iso-8859-1,...,iso-88: Specifies the character set to use for the output. Note: UTF-8 support is limited to the first 128 Unicode characters that are found in the input.
options.--color: Specifies that PostScript or PDF output should be in color.
options.--continuous: Specifies that the HTML sources are unstructured (plain web pages.) No page breaks are inserted between each file or URL in the output.
options.--datadir directory: Specifies the location of the htmldoc data files, usually /usr/share/htmldoc or C:/Program Files/HTMLDOC.
options.--duplex: Specifies that the output should be formatted for double-sided printing.
options.--effectduration {0.1...10.0}: Specifies the duration in seconds of PDF page transition effects.
options.--embedfonts: Specifies that fonts should be embedded in PDF and PostScript output.
options.--fontsize size: Specifies the default font size for body text.
options.--fontspacing spacing: Specifies  the  default  line spacing for body text. The line spacing is a multiplier for the font size, so a value of 1.2 will provide an additional 20% of space between the lines.
options.--footer fff: Sets the page footer to use on body pages. See the HEADERS/FOOTERS FORMATS section below.
options.--format format, -t format: Specifies the output format: epub, html, htmlsep (separate HTML files for each heading in the table-of-contents), ps or  ps2  (PostScript  Level 2),  ps1 (PostScript Level 1), ps3 (PostScript Level 3), pdf11 (PDF 1.1/Acrobat 2.0), pdf12 (PDF 1.2/Acrobat 3.0), pdf or pdf13 (PDF 1.3/Acrobat 4.0), or pdf14 (PDF 1.4/Acrobat 5.0).
options.--gray: Specifies that PostScript or PDF output should be grayscale.
options.--header fff: Sets the page header to use on body pages. See the HEADERS/FOOTERS FORMATS section below.
options.--header1 fff: Sets the page header to use on the first body/chapter page. See the HEADERS/FOOTERS FORMATS section below.
options.--headfootfont font: Sets the font to use on headers and footers.
options.--headfootsize size: Sets the size of the font to use on headers and footers.
options.--headingfont typeface: Sets the typeface to use for headings.
options.--help: Displays a summary of command-line options.
options.--helpdir directory: Specifies the location of the htmldoc online help files, usually /usr/share/doc/htmldoc or C:/Program Files/HTMLDOC/DOC.
options.--hfimageN filename: Specifies an image (numbered from 1 to 10) to be used in the header or footer in a PostScript or PDF document.
options.--jpeg[=quality]: Sets the JPEG compression level to use for large images. A value of 0 disables JPEG compression.
options.--left margin: Specifies the left margin in points (no suffix or ##pt), inches (##in), centimeters (##cm), or millimeters (##mm).
options.--letterhead filename: Specifies an image to be used as a letterhead in the header or footer in a PostScript or PDF document. Note that you need to use the --header, --header1, and/or --footer options with the L parameter or use the corresponding HTML page comments to display the letterhead image in the header or footer.
options.--links: Enables generation of links in PDF files (default).
options.--logoimage filename: Specifies an image to be used as a logo in the header or footer in a PostScript or PDF document, and in the navigation bar of a  HTML  document. Note  that you need to use the --header, --header1, and/or --footer options with the l parameter or use the corresponding HTML page comments to display the logo image in the header or footer.
options.--no-compression: Disables compression of PostScript or PDF files.
options.--no-embedfonts: Specifies that fonts should not be embedded in PDF and PostScript output.
options.--no-jpeg: Disables JPEG compression of large images.
options.--no-links: Disables generation of links in a PDF document.
options.--no-localfiles: Disables access to local files on the system. This option should be used when providing remote document conversion services.
options.--no-pscommands: Disables generation of PostScript setpagedevice commands.
options.--no-title: Disables generation of a title page.
options.--no-toc: Disables generation of a table of contents.
options.--numbered: Numbers all headings in a document.
options.--nup pages: Sets the number of pages that are placed on each output page. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 6, 9, and 16.
options.--outdir directory, -d directory: Specifies that output should be sent to a directory in multiple files. (Not compatible with PDF output)
options.--outfile filename, -f filename: Specifies that output should be sent to a single file.
options.--owner-password password: Sets the owner password for encrypted PDF files.
options.--pageduration I{1.0...60.0}: Sets the view duration of a page in a PDF document.
options.--pageeffect effect: Specifies the page transition effect for all pages; this attribute is ignored by all Adobe PDF viewers.
options.--pagelayout {single,one,twoleft,tworigh: Specifies the initial layout of pages for a PDF file.
options.--pagemode {document,outlines,fullscreen: Specifies the initial viewing mode for a PDF file.
options.--path: Specifies a search path for files in a document.
Specifies document permissions for encrypted PDF files. The following permissions are understood: all, none, annotate,  no-annotate,  copy,  no-copy, modify, no-modify, print, and no-print. Separate multiple permissions with commas.
options.--pre-indent distance: Specifies the indentation of pre-formatted text in points (no suffix or ##pt), inches (##in), centimeters (##cm), or millimeters (##mm).
options.--pscommands: Specifies that PostScript setpagedevice commands should be included in the output.
options.--quiet: Suppresses all messages, even error messages.
options.--referer url: Specifies the URL that is passed in the Referer: field of HTTP requests.
options.--right margin: Specifies the right margin in points (no suffix or ##pt), inches (##in), centimeters (##cm), or millimeters (##mm).
options.--size pagesize: Specifies  the  page  size using  a  standard name or in points (no suffix or ##x##pt), inches (##x##in), centimeters (##x##cm), or millimeters (##x##mm). The standard sizes that are currently recognized are "letter" (8.5x11in),  "legal"  (8.5x14in), "a4"  (210x297mm),  and  "universal" (8.27x11in).
options.--textcolor color: Specifies the default color of all text.
options.--title: Enables the generation of a title page.
options.--titlefile filename: Specifies a HTML or Markdown file to use for the title page.
options.--titleimage filename: Specifies the title image for the title page. The supported formats are GIF, JPEG, and PNG.
options.--tocfooter fff: Sets the page footer to use on table-of-contents pages. See the HEADERS/FOOTERS FORMATS section below.
options.--tocheader fff: Sets the page header to use on table-of-contents pages. See the HEADERS/FOOTERS FORMATS section below.
options.--toclevels levels: Sets the number of levels in the table-of-contents.
options.--toctitle string: Sets the title for the table-of-contents.
options.--top margin: Specifies the top margin in points (no suffix or ##pt), inches (##in), centimeters (##cm), or millimeters (##mm).
options.--user-password password: Specifies the user password for encryption of PDF files.
options.--webpage: Specifies that the HTML sources are unstructured (plain web pages.) A page break is inserted between each file or URL in the output.

requirements: '--letterhead' must be used with either '--header' or '--footer'
'--user-password' must be used with both '--format' and '--encryption'
